page.description: Generates a sort expression from an input array of sort keys

argument.name: Order_Expression
argument.description: An order expression suitable to use with query.order.

argument.name: sort_data
argument.description: The a_sort[] array has three properties that must be set for each field in the order expression.

item.name: .expression
item.description: The name of a field or an expression involving one or more fields.

item.name: .type
item.description: The data type of the field.

page.discussion: The A5_SORT_EXPRESSION() function builds a order expression for a table. The fields may be of any type.
page.example:
dim a_sort[3] as P a_sort[1].expression = "salary" a_sort[1].type = "n" a_sort[1].direction = "D"
? a5_sort_expression(a_sort) = "invert(salary)"
a_sort[2].expression = "lastname" a_sort[2].type = "c" a_sort[2].direction = "a"
? a5_sort_expression(a_sort) = "invert( str(salary,19,5) )+lastname"
